title.narrative: 4.1 CHILD RIGHTS AND BUSINESS - PPO

description.narrative: Increased knowledge, capacity and commitment of selected businesses with high impact on children to integrate child rights into operations and policies, which contributes to Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, concrete actions are taken by civil society, the corporate sector and the public for social changes that address critical child rights concerns

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased knowledge, capacity and commitment of selected businesses with high impact on children to integrate child rights intooperations and policies

description.narrative: UNICEF continued its strategic partnership with VCCI and partners to strengthen the understanding, capacity and commitment of key businesses to respect and support children’s rights in Viet Nam. UNICEF and VCCI have been gradually positioning CRB in the 2030 Sustainable Development Agenda for Viet Nam to improve policy advocacy and work on how to best regulate business operations and their impact on children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:03/02/2022
